text: Meghan Lorence is an American ice hockey forward, currently playing for the Minnesota Whitecaps in the NWHL. == Career == Across 4 years at the University of Minnesota, Lorence put up 102 points in 158 games, serving as an assistant captain in her final year. The team would be NCAA national champions three times during her tenure. In 2019, she signed her first professional contract with the Minnesota Whitecaps of the NWHL. She was named to the 2020 NWHL All- Star Game, replacing the unavailable Sydney Baldwin. === International === In 2010, she represented the US at the U18 IIHF U18 Women's World Championships, winning a silver medal. == References == ==External links== * Biographical information and career statistics from Elite Prospects Category:Minnesota Whitecaps players Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:People from Ramsey County, Minnesota Category:American women's ice hockey forwards Category:Ice hockey people from Minnesota
title: Meghan Lorence
